text: Compare these Problems to those in the Unit. How are they the same? Different? In what ways are the proportional relationships in this Unit the same as or different from those in other Units you have studied this year?

Possible answers:

These Problems are different from many of the Problems in this Unit because there are two outcomes for each part of the situation.

Different from other proportional relationships:

Probabilities in this Unit are ratio comparisons that are part-to-whole. Other Units have had both part-to-part and part-to-whole.

Same as other proportional relationships:

The ratios are scaled up or down to make predictions. Proportions can help you find equivalent ratios to answer questions.

Did You Know?

The World Series started in 1903 as a best-of-nine games series. From 1905 until 1919, the series changed to the best-of-seven games.

After World War I ended, the series changed back to the best-of-nine games from 1919 to 1921. From 1922 until now, the series has remained a best-of-seven series.

Between 1922 and 2022, the World Series ended in 4 games 19 times. It ended in 5 games 21 times. It ended in 6 games 21 times. It ended in 7 games 38 times.

There was no World Series in 1994.

To see the data, visit https://www.britannica.com/sports/World-Series
